prompt.content: Our goal is to pack a set of objects into a box, which is called 'bin packing'. In a problem instance, there is a box, a manipulator robot, and objects set. In the object set, we have various objects that can be picked and placed by the manipulator robot. We want to consider physical properties of the objects such as {fragility}, {flexibility}, {deformability}, and {rigidity}.

Given this goal, I want to make a domain.pddl considering the physical propoerties of the objects. The domain file is supposed to include predicates such as is_fragile, is_flexible, and etc. Actions must consider the predicates in preconditions and effects.
During packing the objects, I want to follow several rules. First, put a fragile object on top of a soft object to prevent breaking the fragile object.
Second, a flexible object is preferred to be folded to make it compact so as to secure spaces for other objects.
Third, a rigid object should not be pressed hard.
Fourth, a deformable object can be pressed if possible.
